column4: i'm trying to run no-ip, but it keeps saying it can't find the config file
can't you read? it exactly tells you which config file it wants
but then it still tells me that it can't locate it
what part of what I wrote didn't you undestand? why are you unable to check if /etc//no-ip.conf exists and if not create it?
exists, and i used -C to create once
it fscking doesn't exist. are you  analphabetic?
what are the permissions of the file?
permissions were all at root, then i changed it to my user hoping that would fix it
ok, i tried deleting the config file then making a new one with -C, but now i'm getting permission denied.
how what would i use to give write access too?
thanks a lot! i think i've got it now!
